text: [Music]
since graduating probably the most
substantial piece of work that I've done
has been to um lead the research effort
for my organization tntp on um teacher
retention so we published I led a
two-year research effort and we
published this past summer a report
called the irreplaceables looking at the
retention patterns of teachers in um in
high need public schools and found that
the best the very best teachers left uh
those districts at the at the same rate
as the lowest performing teachers and
this has a pretty big impact on um
students because the best teachers can
produce up to five five to six
additional months of learning per
Academic Year so um by pushing dat by
pushing large urban districts to think
about their human Capital Management
their talent management practices
differently and think about how they can
retain more of their very best teachers
and um either Exit or improve their
lowest performing teachers that has the
potential to have a really big impact on
um students and and in particular the
students who need great teachers the
most I've always been passionate about
public education and see myself staying
in this field for the foreseeable future
so would like to continue um working in
the Ed Reform movement to improve public
schools and the opportunities to access
excellent education particularly for
high need and uh low-income students
